bioghist.p: Edgar M. Dilley (1874-1960) graduated from the University of Pennsylvania in 1897. After college, he worked as a reporter on a number of papers in Philadelphia, New York, Chicago, and St. Louis. He was the author of "Ave, Penn Charter," a school song for his preparatory school; Red Fox's Son (a novel), and "Hail, Pennsylvania," the alma mater of the University of Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of typed and handwritten manuscripts of Edgar M. Dilley. The manuscripts include drafts of Dilley's musical compositions, including "Pennsylvania," screenplays, stories, plays, essays, and comic operas. Manuscript titles include "The Idol's Eye," "A Pair of Kings," "Why Men Don't Go to Church," "The Forbidden Trail: An Historical Romance of Oregon," and "The Drummer Boy: A Civil War Opera."

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
